nightfall package¶

Submodules¶

nightfall.game_classes module¶

class nightfall.game_classes.Character(name, health, magic, level, magic_defense, magic_power, defense, attack_power)¶

Bases: object

Character class parent to Monster and Player classes.

health¶

int – Character dies when this reaches zero.

magic¶

int – Using spells drains this attribute.

level¶

int – Relative measure of toughness (the combination of all offensive and defensive stats and abilities).

magic_defense¶

int – Reduces magic damage.

magic_power¶

int – Increases magic damage.

defense¶

int – Reduces physical damage.

attack_power¶

int – Increases physical damage.

get_attack_power()¶
get_attack_type(attack_choice)¶
get_defense()¶
get_health()¶
get_level()¶
get_magic()¶
get_magic_defense()¶
get_magic_power()¶
get_name()¶
set_attack_power(attack_power)¶
set_defense(defense)¶
set_health(health)¶
set_level(level)¶
set_magic(magic)¶
set_magic_defense(magic_defense)¶
set_magic_power(magic_power)¶
class nightfall.game_classes.Item(name, description, durability, stats)¶

Bases: object

Item class tracks the state of items used by the player.

name¶

str – Name that the item is called.

description¶

str – Description of the characteristics of the item.

stats¶

dictionary(str, int) – Stats that item boosts.

decrement_durability()¶
get_description()¶
get_durability()¶
get_name()¶
get_stats()¶
class nightfall.game_classes.Monster(name, description, loot, health, magic, level, magic_defense, magic_power, defense, attack_power)¶

Bases: nightfall.game_classes.Character

Monster class tracks the state of monster characters.

name¶

str – The name of the monster.

description¶

str – The description of the monster.

loot¶

item – The item that the monster drops.

class nightfall.game_classes.Player(name, health, magic, level, magic_defense, magic_power, defense, attack_power, num_lives, experience, memory, backpack, equipped_item, rescue_evelyn=False)¶

Bases: nightfall.game_classes.Character

Player class tracks the state of the user controlled Character.

experience¶

int – Tracks points until next level.

memory¶

list(str) – Tracks both features and items that a character has inspected.

backpack (list(

obj:Item)): Tracks items that the character is carrying.

equipped_item (

obj:Item): Tracks item that the character is using.

class nightfall.game_classes.Ranger(name, health, magic, level, magic_defense, magic_power, defense, attack_power, num_lives, experience, memory, backpack, equipped_item, rescue_evelyn=False)¶

Bases: nightfall.game_classes.Player

Wizard class tracks the state of wizard characters.

Attributes:

class nightfall.game_classes.Room(name, description, item_list, monster_list, player, adjacent_rooms, door_map, features, puzzle_dict)¶

Bases: object

Room class representing primary game map that player navigates.

description¶

tuple(str, str) – Contains long and short description of room. Long description at tuple[0], short description at tuple[1].

item_list (list(

obj:Item)): List of all Item objects in the room.

monster_list (list(

obj:Monster)): List of all Monster objects in room.

player (

obj:Player): Player object used to access player in the room. Is None if no player is present.

adjacent_rooms¶

dictionary(str, str) – Contains map of directions connected to room names that are accessible from current room. For example: {‘south’: ‘fortress entrance’}.

door_map¶

dictionary(str, bool) – Map of doors in room. Takes a string (‘north’, ‘east’, ‘south’, ‘west’) and returns a bool representing if the door is locked (True if locked).

features¶

dictionary(str, str) – Dictionary contains all of this rooms feature names mapped to the text description of that feature.

puzzle_dict¶

dictionary(str, bool) – Dictionary used to track the state of puzzles in a room. True means the puzzle is not solved.

add_feature(feature, feature_description)¶
add_item(item)¶
add_monster(monster)¶

Bases: nightfall.game_classes.Player

nightfall.aliases module¶

nightfall.aliases.item_alias_check(command)¶

Check for item aliases.

Parameters:command (str) – Corresponds to new_command2 in text_parser.py file. Is a string that is the user input.
Returns:
If an alias matches it returns the item name that is used verbs
by the feature and item handler. If an alias does not match it returns the unmodified command string as taken from text_parser.py
Return type:str
nightfall.aliases.move_alias_check(current_room_name, user_input)¶

Movement alias check.

Sources used: # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14264163/search-for-any -word-or-combination-of-words-from-one-string-in-a-list-python # https://docs.python.org/2/library/itertools.html

Parameters:
  • current_room_name (str) – Name of the room the player is currently in.
  • user_input (str) – raw user input.
Returns:

If movement command is valid it will return the name of the room

that the player wants to travel to. Otherwise it will return the user_input just as it was received.
Return type:

str
nightfall.aliases.verb_alias_check(command)¶

Check for aliases of 10 core verbs.

Parameters:command (str) – Corresponds to new_command2 in text_parser.py file. Is a string that is the user input.
Returns:
If an alias matches it returns one of the 10 core verbs the
game uses. If an alias does not match it returns the unmodified command string as taken from text_parser.py
Return type:str

nightfall.feature_handler.room_1_feature_handler(current_room, verb, feature)¶

Handles verb commands related to room 1 features.

Puzzles:
None
Room Items:
Sword: +1 attack power.
Features:
door body cloak bag
Parameters:
  • current_room (Room) – The current room the player is in.
  • verb (str) – The action the user would like to take.
  • feature (str) – The feature in this room the user would like to act on.

nightfall.file_manager.load_game()¶

Enables user to load prior saved game.

nightfall.file_manager.load_object(object_name)¶

Load object from binary file.

Parameters:object_name (string) – Name of the object to be loaded from file. Object name should match the file name trying to be loaded.
Returns:obj:: Returns the object type that the file stores.
nightfall.file_manager.save_game(current_room)¶

Save entire game state to new file or overwrite current file.

Parameters:( (current_room) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is located in.
nightfall.file_manager.save_game_state(current_room, destination_path)¶

Save game state to specified file.

Parameters:
  • ( (current_room) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is in.
  • destination_path (str) – The file path to the new save location.
nightfall.file_manager.save_object_state(game_object)¶

Serialize object into binary file.

Parameters:( (game_object) – obj:): Takes a class object for serialization. Object must have a get_name() method for this function to work.

nightfall.game_methods module¶

nightfall.game_methods.choose_character()¶

Function to select Wizard or Ranger as character.

Returns:A string that is Wizard or Ranger.
Return type:str
nightfall.game_methods.choose_name(character_choice)¶

Ask user to enter their character name.

Parameters:character_choice (str) – String that is either Wizard or Ranger.
Returns:The name the player entered for themselves.
Return type:str
nightfall.game_methods.combat(player, monster)¶

Function to allow for player monster rpg combat.

Parameters:
  • ( (monster) – obj:Player): The user selected main character.
  • ( – obj:Monster): A character that the player fights.
nightfall.game_methods.game_menu(current_room)¶

Calls in game menu for use during play.

Parameters:( (current_room) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is in.
nightfall.game_methods.getrandbits(k) → x. Generates an int with k random bits.¶
nightfall.game_methods.handle_standard_action(current_room, player, action)¶

Handles standard one word game commands.

Parameters:
  • ( (player) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is in.
  • ( – obj:Player): The current player.
  • action (str) – The user entered command to be handled.
nightfall.game_methods.help_menu()¶

scroll_print a list of available commands for the user.

nightfall.game_methods.is_game_over(player)¶

Checks to see if the player still has lives.

Parameters:( (player) – obj:Player): The main character of the game.
Returns:False if the character is dead or the game is complete.
Return type:bool
nightfall.game_methods.print_item_descriptions(current_room)¶

Prints the descriptions of all of the items in a room.

Parameters:( (current_room) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is in.

nightfall.game_methods.start_game(player_name, character_choice)¶

Create game files, load initial room, and load player.

Parameters:player_name (str) – The user selected main character name.
Returns:obj:Room: The current room that the player is in.
nightfall.game_methods.starting_menu()¶

Creates menu viewed when game first starts.

Returns:A string that is the menu option chosen by the user.
Return type:str
nightfall.game_methods.take_action(current_room, action)¶

Handles parsed input to perform actions in game.

Parameters:
  • ( (current_room) – obj:Room): Current room that the player is in.
  • action (dictionary(str, str)) – A dictionary mapping possible actions to either features or items.
nightfall.game_methods.travel(current_room, direction)¶

Move player from one room to another.

Parameters:
  • ( (current_room) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is in.
  • direction (str) – Either north, east, south, west.

Handle any non-unique verb and item interactions.

  • ( (current_room) – obj:Room): The current room that the player is in.
  • verb (str) – The action a user would like to take.
  • item_name (str) – The name of the item the user would like to use.

nightfall.scroll_print module¶

nightfall.scroll_print.scroll_print(text)¶

Prints text 1 character at a time to simulate scrolling text.

Parameters:text (str) – The text to be printed.

nightfall.text_parser module¶

nightfall.text_parser.get_input()¶

Get raw user input.

Returns:Raw user input.
Return type:str
nightfall.text_parser.parse_input(input, current_room)¶

Divide input into recognizable components.

Parameters:input (str) – Raw user input.
Returns:
Dictionary of command mapped to the item or
feature that the command is acting on.
Return type:dictionary(str, str)
